overview: This measure has been amended to incorporate four additional claims that were resolved, increasing the total number of claims from seventeen to twenty-one. The purpose of the bill remains to appropriate funds for claims against the State, its officers, or its employees. The scope has expanded to include new settlements involving additional state departments.
appropriations: The total appropriation for fiscal year 2024-2025 is increased to $6,498,867.07 to satisfy twenty-one claims. This includes an increased general fund appropriation of $5,158,867.07 and an unchanged departmental fund appropriation of $1,340,000. The additional $587,632.85 from the general fund is allocated to cover the four newly added claims.
agency_impact: The list of impacted agencies has been expanded to include the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands and the Department of Taxation. These departments are now responsible for processing payments related to the newly added claims. This is in addition to the previously listed departments.
revenue_sources: The funding sources remain the state's general revenues and departmental funds. The amount appropriated from general revenues has increased from $4,571,234.22 to $5,158,867.07 to cover the four new settlements. The appropriation from departmental funds remains $1,340,000.
six_year_fiscal_implications: The fiscal implication is a one-time expenditure in fiscal year 2024-2025, with the total amount increasing to $6,498,867.07. The general fund portion of this cost is now $5,158,867.07, while the departmental fund portion remains $1,340,000. This updated total reflects the addition of four new claims for the Department of Defense ($5,000), Department of Education ($150,000), Department of Hawaiian Home Lands ($400,000), and Department of Taxation ($32,632.85). The appropriations are for settlements and judgments and do not create recurring costs. Any unencumbered funds will lapse on June 30, 2026. This measure does not create any new positions or ongoing operational expenses beyond the single payment.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the increase in the total appropriation from $5,911,234.22 to $6,498,867.07. This change results from adding four new claims totaling $587,632.85, increasing the total number of claims to twenty-one. Consequently, the general fund appropriation has increased from $4,571,234.22 to $5,158,867.07, and the list of impacted agencies now includes the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands and the Department of Taxation.
